intro: Palicourea sucllii, commonly known as the yellow palicourea, is a climbing shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, opposite leaves, and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to yellow. Its fruits are typically small berries that contain seeds. Palicourea sucllii is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
